title: Deal Advisory Manager
experiences_and_skills: The ideal candidate for this role will have at least two years of demonstrated experience performing work across an array of M&A engagements in a large regional/national public accounting firm or related professional services consulting environment. Bachelor's Degree in Accounting (preferred), Finance or related business discipline. 5+ years of professional services experience, with a minimum of 2+ years of direct Financial Due Diligence (Prior Big 4, National or large Regional firm experience preferred). Active CPA license or in-progress required. Strong accounting, data analysis/mining and critical thinking skills. Effective communication skills (both oral and written) . Positive attitude, strong work ethic and excellent interpersonal and relationship building skills . Able to prioritize tasks and manage assigned portions of engagements.  Opportunities to connect and learn from professionals from different backgrounds and with different cultures.  “Cherry Bekaert” is the brand name under which Cherry Bekaert LLP and Cherry Bekaert Advisory LLC, independently owned entities, provide professional services in an alternative practice structure in accordance with applicable professional standards.  Individual salaries within this range are determined by a variety of factors including but not limited to education, experience, knowledge, skills, and geographic location. Candidates must demonstrate they are eligible to work in the United States

title: Managing Director, Life Sciences
experiences_and_skills: BDO is looking for a top performing a Life Sciences Managing Director within its Industry Specialty Services (ISSG) practice.  Performs mission support services including organizational strategy, enterprise optimization, financial strategy and enablement, risk and compliance, technology enablement, and other functions that enable client success .  Identifies and stratifies each market, which includes defining the Total Addressable Market (TAM), Serviceable Available Market (SAM), and Serviceable Obtainable Market (SOM) .  Other duties as required . Qualifications, Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:.  Bachelor’s degree, required .  Advanced degree MS, MBA, PhD, or ScD, preferred . Experience.  Ten (10) or more years of experience managing complex clients and sales cycles, required .  Experience developing and growing project-based, professional consulting services, characterized by long sales cycles and both large and small dollar transactions, required .  Successful track record of business development within the Life Science industry segments, required .  Experience building relationships, networking and influencing CXOs and senior business decision-makers, required .  Experience and adept at aligning teams to work toward a common goal, consistently demonstrates strong people management skills, required .  Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, required . Other Knowledge, Skills & Abilities.  Ability to create profitable annuity streams selling services .  Excellent knowledge of Life Sciences marketplace, including subject matter knowledge of CMC product development, including expertise in one or more of the following areas: process and analytical development, manufacturing, QA/QC, supply chain, regulatory .  Outstanding written and verbal communication skills; able to adapt communication style to multiple stakeholders and cultures .  Ability to travel up to 40-50%, on average, based on work, client, and industry/sector needs . Deep industry knowledge and participation. Above offerings may be subject to eligibility requirements

Support large scale post-merger integrations efforts to enable recognition of synergies and consolidate business structures, systems, and processes .  Manage ERP strategy development, requirements gathering, ERP software selections, and vendor negotiations .  Analyze client data, measure Key performance Indicators (KPIs), and conduct benchmarking exercises to drive actionable insights and provide recommendations for performance improvement .  Trains Associates and Senior Associates on how to use current software tools and Industry Specialty Services methodology . Qualifications, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:.  Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or Information Systems, required .  Advanced degree, preferred . Experience.  Five (5) or more years of relevant experience, including experience in management consulting and/or client facing engagement delivery, required .  Prior experience in business processes, including Revenue Cycle, Procurement Cycle, Retorting Cycle, and/or Human Capital Cycle, required .  Experience working with Nonprofits, ERP systems (Costpoint, Unanet, Microsoft Dynamics 365) or other project-based systems, preferred .  Experience with FAR, DFARS, CAS, and 2 CFR 200, preferred . Other Knowledge, Skills & Abilities.  Excellent verbal and written communication skills, specifically business / report writing .  Strong analytical and basic research skills .  Solid organizational skills especially ability to meet project deadlines with a focus on details .  Ability to successfully multi-task while working independently or within a group environment .  Proven ability to work in a deadline-driven environment and handle multiple projects simultaneously .  Ability to follow and apply specific rules and regulations .  Ability to work with minimal supervision . Deep industry knowledge and participation. Above offerings may be subject to eligibility requirements

title: Infrastructure Senior Project Manager
experiences_and_skills: This role requires the ability to work with a diverse client base and requires effective communications and technical skills with the ability to educate a client about program progress, opportunities, and risks to drive appropriate timely program decisions. Qualified individuals must either reside in or near Metro Detroit or Cincinnati or be willing to relocate for this opportunity. title: Tax Senior - Financial Services
experiences_and_skills: You will assist in the professional development of other tax staff and participate in client proposals and new business development opportunities. This is a national practice. Conduct online tax research using tools such Bloomberg Tax and tax preparation using CCH Axcess and other applicable tax software programs. Participate in client proposal opportunities when required. Years of experience required: 3+ years relevant tax experience working in a CPA firm, a professional services firm, a tax consulting practice or a large corporate tax department . Education required: Bachelor of Science degree in Accounting or a business-related field, an advanced tax degree (MST, JD, LLM) is a plus . Certification required/preferred: CPA license or pursuing completion of the CPA exam . Prior work experience with banks, investments and capital markets. Strong computer skills including proficiency with Microsoft Office tools. Working knowledge of CCH Axcess and other tax preparation and research software programs. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills (both oral and written). Excellent analytical and organizational skills. Ability to travel to client locations when needed. The salary range for this role takes into account many factors including, but not limited to, years and type of experience, skill sets, and certifications.  With roots going back to 1921 in the US, the firm has significant national presence in strategic geographies, providing seamless access to 26,000+ professionals around the world

title: Tax Senior Manager - Cincinnati
experiences_and_skills: Candidates should be accustomed to working as the main point of contact with the client and will be comfortable in managing workflows, deadlines, deliverables, and client communications. experiences_and_skills: Cherry Bekaert's Alternative Investments practice provides Tax, Assurance and Advisory services to clients operating across an array of different investment sectors. title: Employee Benefits Consulting- Senior Client Services Coordinator
experiences_and_skills: It means that all staff members have equitable and fair opportunities to succeed, in an inclusive environment, with their individual, unique identities.  Administrative support for the EBC 5500 practice: Internal account management, implementation and maintenance, production of internal and client reports, proposals, presentations, organization, and internal data management .  Assist with administrative functions within the 5500 practice, primarily related to monitoring due dates and deadlines, collection and review of client provided data, specific organizational functions and dissemination of information to/from staff and firm management .  Opportunity to assist with client deliverables, participation in client meetings, and integration with client engagement/team events .  HS Diploma or GED equivalent required.  Associates degree in administrative/paralegal/business administration or similar background preferred .  Strong organizational skills required, attention to detail, and ability to multi-task .  3 to 5 years of relevant experience .  Qualified individuals must reside in or near Grand Rapids, MI.  This position may require some local and inter-state travel .  Candidates must be legally authorized to work in the United States without sponsorship, with the exception of candidates that are bilingual in Japanese and English

High degree of effective advanced analytical and problem-solving skills and judgment with specific application to medical and financial data. Strong ability to consistently prepare and review accurate analyses, projections and budget v

title: Tax Director - PCS
experiences_and_skills: Provide guidance and experience to ensure that engagement risks are identified and appropriate responses (including specific tax steps) are taken. Work with engagement and client personnel to address extremely complex tax and accounting issues, reviews all finished tax deliverables and tax accruals for accuracy and completeness, and ensure that client communications (written and oral) are provided in a timely manner to avoid surprises. Contribute to overall office efficiency by providing feedback on staff performance, participating in initiatives for on-going staff development, and developing a teaming culture (through informal social and professional events). Minimum of 10 years of experience in public accounting. Bachelor's degree in accounting. Excellent project management, analytical, interpersonal, oral and written communication skills. Ability to lead and develop Tax Staff, Seniors, Managers, and Senior Managers. Experience preparing complex federal corporate (C and S), multi-state, individual, and partnership returns. Basic knowledge of financial services products. Strong understanding of IRS practice and procedure. Ability to review complex tax planning projects and identification of additional planning opportunities. Ability to understand, apply, and be able to help staff understand and apply policies from tax quality control documents. Opportunities to connect and learn from professionals from different backgrounds and with different cultures.  “Cherry Bekaert” is the brand name under which Cherry Bekaert LLP and Cherry Bekaert Advisory LLC, independently owned entities, provide professional services in an alternative practice structure in accordance with applicable professional standards.  Individual salaries within this range are determined by a variety of factors including but not limited to education, experience, knowledge, skills, and geographic location. Ensures compliance with engagement independence requirements and consults internally as needed .  Applies advanced knowledge and understanding of professional standards; application of the principles contained in professional standards; and the ability to document and communicate an understanding and application of professional standards on an engagement. Communicates matters required to be reported to the Audit Committee/Board and those charged with governance .  Applies advanced knowledge and application of BDO standards, policies and technology that guide effective and efficient delivery of quality services and products. Applies advanced knowledge of all appropriate research tools and draws conclusions based upon appropriate research .  Other duties as required . Qualifications, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:.  Bachelor’s degree, required; major in Accounting, Finance, Economics or Statistics, preferred .  Master’s degree in Accountancy, preferred . Experience. Active licensed US CPA, recognized active International Equivalent or unique qualification as defined by BDO’s Assurance Licensing Policy, required .  If active international equivalent or unique qualifications, required to obtain an active US CPA license within approved timeframe as defined by firm licensing requirement guidelines .  Experience with assurance applications and research tools, preferred . Other Knowledge, Skills & Abilities.  Ability to demonstrate strong leadership skills and be a role model to managers and staff .  Advanced GAAP and GAAS knowledge .  Sound working knowledge of SEC and PCAOB rules .  Possess proven excellent verbal and written communication skills .  Possess executive presence - need to be able to be primary contact for the client, prepare and present presentations to clients and potential clients .  Possess excellent client development/relationship-building skills .  Possess excellent decision-making skills .  Ability to substantially take charge of entire simple engagement .  Ability to resolve complex accounting issues .  Ability to be responsible for business development and marketing .  Has knowledge of and can promote the use of all BDO client service specialties/offerings, including BDO International and the BDO Alliance .  Ability to be responsible for engagement profitability, including billings and collections, and maintaining engagement team focus on productivity and efficiency . experiences_and_skills: As a member of the GPS team, you will help clients protect and enhance the value of their organizations by leveraging their system of internal controls to enable growth, manage risk, and define sustainable operations.  you will be responsible for performing specific engagement activities under the supervision of a project manager, participate in discussions with clients, and assist with drafting deliverables. Internal control and best practice evaluation. Prior experience with audit, accounting, and/or consulting standards (GASB, AICPA, GAS including Yellow Book/Green Book). Effective oral and written communication skills. Ability to multi-task and adapt to rapidly changing environments. Ability to travel 15% of the time. Preferred skills and experience:. State & Local experience – with implementation of GASB standards. Experience with GFOA’s ACFR Special Review Process. Ability to troubleshoot and solve account reconciliation issues. Prior experience coaching and developing less experienced associates. Cherry Bekaert is proud to have over 75 years of experience in Accounting and Advisory services. Fully Remote position options available and/or hybrid . Collaborative environment providing career growth and continuous professional development. title: Accounts Receivable Specialist
experiences_and_skills: Accounts Receivable duties include ensuring the accuracy and efficiency of operations, processing and monitoring incoming payments, and securing revenue by verifying and posting receipts. Perform day-to-day financial transactions, including verifying, classifying, computing, posting, and recording accounts receivables' data. Reconcile the accounts receivable ledger to ensure that all payments are accounted for and properly posted. Generate financial statements and reports detailing accounts receivable status. Requirements:. Solid understanding of basic accounting principles, fair credit practices and collection regulations. Proven ability to calculate, post and manage accounting figures and financial records. Data entry skills along with a knack for numbers. Hands-on experience in operating spreadsheets and accounting software (Microsoft Dynamics). Proficiency in MS Office. Customer service orientation and negotiation skills. High degree of accuracy and attention to detail

title: Senior Analyst, Global Credit Fund Management Structured Credit
experiences_and_skills: Founded in 1987 in Washington, DC, Carlyle has grown into one of the world's largest and most successful investment firms, with more than 2,200 professionals operating in 28 offices in North America, South America, Europe, the Middle East, Asia and Australia.  Carlyle invests across three segments - Global Private Equity, Global Credit and Investment Solutions - and has expertise in various industries, including: aerospace, defense & government services, consumer & retail, energy, financial services, healthcare, industrial, real estate, technology & business services, telecommunications & media and transportation.  Carlyle Global Credit is seeking an experienced individual responsible for supporting all aspects of the fund management, fund accounting and financial reporting for Carlyle Structured Credit business including Collateralized Loan Obligations (CLOs) and liquid credit SMAs. Coordinate corporate deliverables and disclosures for firm's public company reporting. Facilitate mid-year planning discussions and coordination deliverables with Corporate / External Tax Teams. Requirements. Bachelor's degree, required. Professional Experience. Minimum of 2+ years' relevant experience, required. Experience in either structured credit or public accounting, strongly preferred. Knowledge of U. Knowledge of CLOs or Structured Finance is a plus. Ability to work under pressure to meet tight deadlines and balance multiple priorities. An innovative and analytical thinker with strong problem-solving skills. Strong organizational skills with the ability to own and see projects to completion. Strong interpersonal skills and a team player. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbal.  Additionally, the hired professional may also be eligible to participate in an annual discretionary incentive program, the award of which will be dependent on various factors, including, without limitation, individual and organizational performance

title: Senior Analyst, Global Credit Fund Management Direct Lending
experiences_and_skills: Founded in 1987 in Washington, DC, Carlyle has grown into one of the world's largest and most successful investment firms, with more than 2,100 professionals operating in 29 offices in North America, South America, Europe, the Middle East, Asia and Australia.  Carlyle invests across three segments - Global Private Equity, Global Credit and Investment Solutions - and has expertise in various industries, including: aerospace, defense & government services, consumer & retail, energy, financial services, healthcare, industrial, real estate, technology & business services, telecommunications & media and transportation. This position, where applicable, will involve a broad range of responsibilities, summarized below: . This position also requires the ability to work and communicate effectively across various levels of management and organization groups. Requirements. Bachelors degree, required. Professional Experience. 2-4 years related industry experience required. Big 4 accounting firm background is a plus. 1940 Act/BDC experience is a plus. Strong educational background in accounting/finance. Knowledge of the credit investment universe (including, but not limited to, CLO's, Term Loans, Revolvers). Strong interpersonal skills a must. Strong organizational skills and detail oriented.  Attention to detail a must. Excellent communication skills - both written and oral. Demonstrated ability to work effectively as part of a team and successfully manage multiple responsibilities under strict deadlines.  Additionally, the hired professional may also be eligible to participate in an annual discretionary incentive program, the award of which will be dependent on various factors, including, without limitation, individual and organizational performance

title: Senior Accountant
experiences_and_skills: Qualifications & Experience:. Minimum of 3 years of accounting experience with a public accounting firm. Bachelor's degree in Accounting. Strong technical skills and research capabilities. Detail oriented with the ability to manage multiple projects. CPA certification preferred, but not required. Experience with CCH Axcess Tax, Engagement and Document a plus. Excellent written and verbal communication skills

title: Senior Compensation Analyst
experiences_and_skills: Oversee pay benchmarking processes geography-wide, assess regional practice to ensure the marketplace is maintained in line with agreed pay principles and advise where inconsistency exists. Consolidate recommendations for the annual pay review from across the region, ensuring financial impact is accurately costed and that awards are budgeted, adhere to any legislative requirements, and reflect market trends and key economic factors. Ensure tools, templates, and communications are available for the effective delivery of the annual pay review for all employees.  This will require working with key global stakeholders and collaborate across all business functions and geographies. Monitor legislative updates to ensure company remains compliant in its pay practices. Manage and oversee appropriate governance of compensation approaches, including management of the exceptions/off-cycle process for non-standard compensation interventions, seeking approval from decision-makers where required. Qualifications & Experience:. Strong Excel skills for compensation data analytics and cost modelling. Ability to use data, analytic approaches, and insight to inform reward program design and evaluate effectiveness. A curious, self-motivated individual up to date on reward trends and best practices. Knowledge of legislation, Total Rewards, and broader HR processes and ways of working. Able to build an effective, commercial business case with costs and benefits identified. Ability to facilitate a matrix group of stakeholders and/or complex projects to a successful outcome (workshops, steering groups). Strong interpersonal and communication skills (able to influence and persuade, build relationships, solve problems, and analyse issues). Strong stakeholder management ability, gaining buy in and commitment to projects and plans. Experienced in solving problems and creating mitigation strategies to ensure successful outcomes
